radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse circumferential thickening of the gastric antrum and all segments of the duodenum, marked 1.0â€“1.5-cm thickening of affected segments compatible with edema, dilated loops of proximal jejunum, adjacent fat stranding and inflammatory changes surrounding the descending and transverse duodenum, no abnormally enlarged lymph nodes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Axial contrast-enhanced CT performed at the level of the transverse duodenum in 2005 revealed no duodenal thickening or inflammatory change. Two months before the current image, there was mild diffuse thickening of the transverse duodenum. The current examination revealed increased and more extensive edematous thickening of the small bowel and gastric antrum.
